comments.body:
Add a todo here to figure out the correct number. This is some magic number that is probably far from the optimal. 
+@yk5 - what your take on this?

You need to refer to Shard() for the proper value of this argument.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/work_sharder.h#L34

"cost_per_unit" is an estimate of the number of CPU cycles (or nanoseconds if not CPU-bound) to complete a unit of work.

The value "500" means each Traverse takes 0.5ms on average, IOW, 2000 traverse calls (or 2000 records) are done per second. Is it a fair estimate?

it was took from here https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/tensor_forest/kernels/model_ops.cc#L207
but i'm open to any suggestions that makes more sense here
Lets add a TODO here. This cost would probably depend on the depth of the tree we have. We will need to run it on a number of trees of diff depth and see the num of cpu cycles
